title: Rear Wheel - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Check the wheel rims for dents or deformation.
Operation with damaged or defective wheels may affect the handling, stability or other aspect of the motorcycle operation.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Position the wheel onto the rear axle and locate onto the four dowels.
Fit the conical spacer, flat side outwards.
Fit the belleville washer, convex side outward.
S2 V220AD 2 is a 220 cSt NLGI 2 High Performance Multipurpose Lithium Calcium Extreme Pressure Grease with Molybdenum Disulphide Solids.
Apply one gram of S2 V220AD 2 grease to rear wheel nut threads.
Apply one gram of S2 V220AD 2 grease to the axle threads on the wheel side only.
Evenly smear the grease around the circumference of the wheel nut threads and the axle shaft threads.

body.name: Rear wheel nut and shaft greased_PJ1_B02180

body.body: After tightening the rear wheel nut,
loosen the nut to align the retaining clip. Continue to tighten the nut to the next available slot.
Loosening of the rear wheel nut to align the retaining clip may cause the rear wheel nut to detach.
A detached wheel nut will lead to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If the retaining clip does not align with any of the six slots, continue to tighten the nut to the next available slot.
loosen the nut to align the retaining clip.
Failure to fit the retaining clip may allow the wheel nut to become detached during use.
A detached wheel nut will lead to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Using a lint free cloth , clean away any excess grease.
Lower the motorcycle to the ground and park it on the side stand.

After tightening the rear wheel nut,
do not
loosen the nut to align the retaining clip. Continue to tighten the nut to the next available slot.
Loosening of the rear wheel nut to align the retaining clip may cause the rear wheel nut to detach.
A detached wheel nut will lead to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If the retaining clip does not align with any of the six slots, continue to tighten the nut to the next available slot.
Do not
loosen the nut to align the retaining clip.
Fit the nut.
Tighten the nut to
230 Nm
Always fit the retaining clip.
Failure to fit the retaining clip may allow the wheel nut to become detached during use.
A detached wheel nut will lead to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit the retaining clip.
